page.title: 04HESTERCOMBE HOUSE
page.content: The beautiful gardens of this Georgian house were designed in 1902 by Edwin Lutyens.1 part & 2 full_time gardeners keep them looking immaculate.Many of the original flowers still grow there. People who work there can use the tennis, croquet and golf facilities. The Orange Room has been set aside for information on the House's history.For example,you can find out why the Amer- ican soldiers made huts in the woods. The House grew too expensive for the Portman family to maintain so Somerset C.C.took it over for use by the fire brigade. On average,12 calls a day come in.They are put on file.The firemen must react to a call in less than two minutes.3 or 4 men must be on duty at all times. The House is open to visitors Tues- days,Wednesdays and Thursdays between 12 & 8pm.
